title: Bug in pad_packed_sequence
body_html:
• OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8
  • GPU models and configuration: K80 (the one on google colab)

-Script for testing
targets,pad_lengths = pack_padded_sequence(captions,lengths,batch_first=True)
targets = pad_packed_sequence((targets,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]
outputs = pad_packed_sequence((outputs,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]

  • I was trying to pad a packed sequence with the following code, but encountered an error saying that for the paddinglength required int but got float. The same code works on pytorch version 0.2.*
body_text:
OS: Ubuntu 16.04
PyTorch version: 0.3.1
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
Python version: 3.6
CUDA/cuDNN version: 8
GPU models and configuration: K80 (the one on google colab)

-Script for testing
      targets,pad_lengths = pack_padded_sequence(captions,lengths,batch_first=True)
   targets = pad_packed_sequence((targets,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]
   outputs = pad_packed_sequence((outputs,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]

I was trying to pad a packed sequence with the following code, but encountered an error saying that for the paddinglength required int but got float. The same code works on pytorch version 0.2.*
body:
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: 0.3.1
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
- Python version: 3.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8
- GPU models and configuration: K80 (the one on google colab)

-Script for testing
 `       targets,pad_lengths = pack_padded_sequence(captions,lengths,batch_first=True) `
    `   targets = pad_packed_sequence((targets,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]`
     `   outputs = pad_packed_sequence((outputs,pad_lengths),batch_first=True)[0]`

- I was trying to pad a packed sequence with the following code, but encountered an error saying that for the paddinglength required int but got float. The same code works on pytorch version 0.2.*
